name: Disabled Veteran Business Enterprise (DVBE) Program
description: DVBE certification gives veteran-owned businesses preference in California state contracts; access 3% statewide participation goal
fullDescription: The California Disabled Veteran Business Enterprise (DVBE) program helps veteran-owned businesses win state contracts. Certified DVBE businesses receive preference in state purchasing and contracting, with a goal that 3% of state contracts go to DVBEs.
whatTheyOffer:
- DVBE certification for state contract bidding
- 3% statewide participation goal for DVBE contracts
- Access to state procurement opportunities
- Business development resources
- Networking with prime contractors
- Technical assistance and training
- Bid preference on certain contracts
howToGetIt:
1. Business must be at least 51% owned by service-disabled veteran
2. Veteran must have 10% or greater service-connected disability
3. Apply through California Department of General Services
4. Submit DD214, VA disability rating letter, and business documents
5. Complete DVBE application online
6. Wait for certification review (typically 30-45 days)
